Be https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14570796/Images/flagBelgium.jpg Currency: Euro Germany invaded Belgium in 1914 as part of the Schlieffen Plan and much of the Western Front fighting of World War I occurred in western parts of the country. The opening months of the war were known as the Rape of Belgium due to German atrocities. Belgium took over the German colonies of Ruanda-Urundi during the war, and they were mandated to Belgium in 1924 by the League of Nations. In the aftermath of the First World War, the Prussian districts of Eupen and Malmedy were annexed by Belgium in 1925, thereby causing the presence of a German-speaking minority. The country was again invaded by Germany in 1940 and was occupied until its liberation by the Allies in 1944. After World War II, a general strike forced king Leopold III, who many saw as collaborating with the Germans during the war, to abdicate in 1951.

n/a c. 1940s Common Belgium Civilian BE-009 BE-009 https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14570796/Images/BE-009.jpg $35 The Belgian L.702 is quite possibly the most commonly found Belgian gas mask from WWII. The mask was carried in a tall metal carrier, with "L.702" stamped on the lid for easy identification. There were several versions of this mask made between the 1930s and 1950s, with the type pictured at right being the most common. One version of this mask designated the L.702 "Typ Activ" was used by Civil Defense and Air Raid teams. There were also several versions exported to other European countries which varied slightly in design and parts.

BEM 4 GP BEM 4 GP
n/a c. 1990s Uncommon/Rare Belgium Military BE-014 BE-014 https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/14570796/Images/BE-014.jpg $249 This modern style Belgian respirator is quite possibly one of the best currently used designs in Europe. The mask features a wide field of view and an adjustable filter inlet. This feature enables the wearer to position the filter canister on either side of the face piece, or below the chin (see details) without removing the filter or changing out other parts (such as a voice-mitter). The BEM 4 GP is also quite comfortable and can be worn for extended periods of time. The mask is carried in a tall, tactical fabric bag. BEM 4 GP masks are now becoming available on the surplus market and are usually in mint, un-issued condition.
